H0.text: Flow through the entire closed circuit is what the wire must provide as a path for electricity from a battery to power a light bulb.

H1.text: Charging the air molecules near the circuit is what the wire must provide a path for the electricity from a battery to power a light bulb.

H2.text: Jump from one battery terminal to the other is what the wire must provide a path for electricity to do in order to power a light bulb from a battery.

H3.text: Change the chemical properties of the wire is what the wire must do to provide a path for electricity from a battery to power a light bulb.

A4.text: An electrical circuit is a network consisting of a closed loop, giving a return path for the current.
